topIssues.title: .eliza needed or plugin-sql crashes, should autocreate
topIssues.author: lalalune

topIssues.title: Snapshot Eligibility Issue + Tangem Wallet Connection Not Supported (Discord Support Compromised)
topIssues.author: pereslavlland
topIssues.body:
Hi ElizaOS team,

I‚Äôm trying to complete the AI16Z ‚Üí ElizaOS migration, but I‚Äôm running into two major issues and Discord support has become unreliable due to impersonators. I need help from the real development team to determine the correct path.

My situation:

‚Ä¢ I purchased AI16Z tokens on Oct 26 using my Phantom wallet.
‚Ä¢ I then moved them to my Tangem wallet for safety.
‚Ä¢ On Nov 11 (snapshot date), the tokens were held inside my Tangem wallet.
‚Ä¢ The migration portal shows my Phantom wallet as ‚Äú0 eligible‚Äù (expected since Phantom didn‚Äôt hold them during snapshot).
‚Ä¢ I cannot connect my Tangem wallet to the migration portal because WalletConnect does not support Tangem.
‚Ä¢ My Tangem wallet was created using key cards only, so I do not have a seed phrase to export into Phantom.

The Discord server is currently compromised ‚Äî multiple impersonators posing as support are entering tickets and attempting to direct users to send tokens manually. Because of this, I cannot rely on Discord support or email responses that appear to be spoofed.

What I need from the real team:

Confirmation of whether Tangem-held tokens during the snapshot are eligible for migration.
Whether a manual backend whitelist update is possible so my Phantom wallet can perform migration safely.
If not, what the official and safe method is for users whose eligible snapshot wallet cannot connect to the portal (Tangem case).
Any announcements regarding potential whitelist updates or support for non-exportable wallets.
I have NOT sent my tokens anywhere and I have NOT interacted with any unofficial links. My tokens are safe. I‚Äôm only seeking official guidance from the verifiable team here on GitHub.

Thank you ‚Äî I appreciate your time. I prefer to resolve this safely through GitHub to avoid Discord impersonation issues.

Activity

- Fixes any and unknown and cast types with real types
- Removes try catch
- Removes sloppy comments
- Removes dead files and code

topPRs.title: feat: enhance streaming support in text generation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

- Streaming support for text generation models
- CLI test runner improvements

# Risks

**Low**. Changes are additive and backward-compatible:
- New streaming API is opt-in via `stream: true` parameter

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Adds streaming support for `TEXT_SMALL` and `TEXT_LARGE` model types, allowing plugins to return text incrementally as it's generated. Also fixes several issues in the CLI test runner.

**Core changes:**
- Add `TextStreamResult` interface with `textStream` async iterable
- Add `stream?: boolean` parameter to `GenerateTextParams`
- Add `supportsStreaming()` type guard for model types
- Update `runtime.useModel()` to handle streaming responses

**CLI test fixes:**
- Fix `startAgents` API signature (array of `{character, plugins}` objects)
- Fix `TestRunner` to exclude `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` from plugin detection
- Fix unit test mock function name (`getDefaultCharacter`)

## What kind of change is this?

- Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation:
- Document the new streaming API for plugin developers
- Update model type documentation with streaming support info

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. `packages/core/src/types/model.ts` - New streaming types
2. `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` - Runtime streaming support
3. `packages/cli/src/utils/test-runner.ts` - Bootstrap exclusion fix
```

topPRs.title: feat: bump deps, fix drizzle-kit across ecosystem
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
## üîÑ Update All Dependencies to Latest Versions

### Problem

Found conflicting `drizzle-orm` versions across the monorepo causing compatibility issues:

- `drizzle-orm@0.45.0` (root)
- `drizzle-orm@0.44.7` (from `@elizaos/plugin-sql`)
- `drizzle-orm@0.38.4` (from `@elizaos/plugin-memory`)
- `drizzle-kit@0.31.x` which is **not compatible** with `drizzle-orm@0.44+`

### Solution

Updated all packages across the monorepo to their latest compatible versions to ensure consistency and resolve dependency conflicts.

### Key Updates

| Package | Before | After |
|---------|--------|-------|
| `bun` | 1.2.21 | 1.3.4 |
| `typescript` | 5.8.x - 5.9.2 | 5.9.3 |
| `zod` | 3.x - 4.1.11 | 4.1.13 |
| `drizzle-orm` | 0.44.2 | 0.45.0 |
| `prettier` | 3.5.3 - 3.6.2 | 3.7.4 |
| `vite` | 6.x - 7.1.7 | 7.2.6 |
| `react` / `react-dom` | 18.3.1 | 19.1.0 |
| `lerna` | 9.0.0 | 9.0.3 |
| `turbo` | 2.5.5 | 2.6.3 |

### Packages Updated

- ‚úÖ Root `package.json`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/core`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/cli` (+ added `@elizaos/plugin-ollama`)
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/client`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/server`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-sql`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/api-client`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/service-interfaces`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/test-utils`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-quick-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/plugin-dummy-services`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/project-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/project-tee-starter`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/app`
- ‚úÖ `@elizaos/config`

### Testing

```bash
bun outdated  # Returns empty - all packages up to date
bun install   # Completes successfully
```

### Notes

- Version bumped `@elizaos/plugin-sql`, `@elizaos/server`, `@elizaos/client` to `1.6.5-alpha.22`
- The `whatwg-url@7.1.0` peer dependency in `plugin-bootstrap` is intentionally pinned for compatibility
